text: The 1985 Montreal Expos season was the 17th season in franchise history. ==Offseason== * November 7, 1984: Chris Welsh was traded by the Expos to the Texas Rangers for Dave Hostetler.Dave Hostetler page at Baseball Reference * November 14, 1984: Larry Walker was signed by the Expos as an amateur free agent.Larry Walker page at Baseball Reference * December 4, 1984: Jack Daugherty was purchased by the Expos from the Helena Gold Sox.Jack Daugherty page at Baseball Reference * December 7, 1984: Bob James was traded by the Expos to the Chicago White Sox for Vance Law.Vance Law page at Baseball Reference * December 7, 1984: Bryan Little was traded by the Expos to the Chicago White Sox for Bert Roberge.Bert Roberge page at Baseball Reference * December 10, 1984 Gary Carter was traded by the Expos to the New York Mets for Hubie Brooks, Mike Fitzgerald, Herm Winningham and Floyd Youmans.Gary Carter page at Baseball Reference * January 9, 1985: Mike Stenhouse was traded by the Expos to the Minnesota Twins for Jack O'Connor.Jack O'Connor page at Baseball Reference * March 28, 1985: Bobby Ramos was released by the Expos.Bobby Ramos page at Baseball Reference ==Spring training== The Expos held spring training at West Palm Beach Municipal Stadium in West Palm Beach, Florida – a facility they shared with the Atlanta Braves. It was their ninth season at the stadium; they had conducted spring training there from 1969 to 1972 and since 1981. ==Regular season== April 30, 1985: In an 11-0 loss to the Philadelphia Phillies, position player Razor Shines pitched one inning as the Expos pitching resources were depleted.Box Score of Game played on Tuesday, April 30, 1985 at Veteran's Stadium ===Opening Day starters=== ===Season standings=== ===Record vs. opponents=== ===Notable transactions=== * May 12, 1985: Dave Hostetler was purchased from the Expos by the Chicago Cubs. * June 3, 1985: Randy Johnson was drafted by the Expos in the 2nd round of the 1985 Major League Baseball Draft. Johnson signed June 9, 1985.Randy Johnson page at Baseball Reference * June 22, 1985: The Expos traded a player to be named later to the Toronto Blue Jays for Mitch Webster. The Expos completed the deal by sending Cliff Young to the Blue Jays on September 10.Cliff Young page at Baseball Reference * August 12, 1985: Doug Frobel was purchased by the Montreal Expos from the Pittsburgh Pirates.https://www.baseball- reference.com/players/f/frobedo01.shtml ===Major League debuts=== *Batters: **Andrés Galarraga (Aug 23) **Al Newman (June 14) *Pitchers: **Tim Burke (Apr 8) **John Dopson (Sep 4) **Floyd Youmans (Jul 1) http://www.thebaseballcube.com/statistics/1985/18.shtml ===Roster=== {| class="toccolours" style="font-size: 95%;" |- !
